Debug.js

Debugging javascript is hard. debug.js is will make it easier. It is a bunch tools which make javascript easier to debug.

Learn more »

NaN detection

Without debug.js

You do lot of Math ? Like in 3d with WebGL ? tired of computations ending with NaN and not knowing where it comes from ? Debug.js can help you!

With debug.js

Just use the strong type checking. It will automatically detect when a property becomes NaN and notify you immediatly. 
PropertyAttr.define(foo, 'bar')
              .typeCheck(['nonan', Number])

assert which actually stop excecution

Without debug.js

It is often best when you are notified immediatly if a issue occurs. But surprisingly, default console.assert() doesn't stop the execution in browser. Assert is stopping the programm execution in other language, but not in javascript. If you find that unfortunate, debug.js can help you!

With debug.js

With assertWhichStop.js, you can trigger an exception or even trigger js debugger as soon as an assertion is false. It is even backward compatible. It is as simple as 
assertWhichStop.overloadConsole();

Private Property and Function

Without debug.js

You handle a large code base ? You wish to ensure that what is supposed to be private is actually private. debug.js can help you.

With debug.js

With privateforjs.js, you can define which functions are allowed to access a given property, or call a function. 
aClass = FunctionAttr.define(aClass).privatize().done();
‹ ›

Features

  • Strong type checking
  • variable value bound checking
  • garbage collector
  • Monitor who allocate object
  • function attribute
  • Function call wrapper
  • queuable getter setter
  • stack extraction
